description: A promotable offering from a brand. Can represent a campaign, product promotion, service, or any other thing the brand wants to make available. Offerings carry structured asset groups for creative assembly and can be promoted via traditional creatives or conversational SI experiences (via the brand's SI agent).

data.tagline: Start measuring your digital carbon footprint today

data.name: Enterprise DSP Platform

data.description: Full-time head chef position at our Amsterdam location
data.name: Head Chef — Amsterdam

assets.description: Structured asset groups for this offering. Each group carries a typed pool of creative assets (headlines, images, videos, etc.) identified by a group ID that matches format-level vocabulary.

checkout_url.description: URL for checkout/purchase flow when the brand doesn't support agentic checkout.

geo_targets.description: Geographic scope of this offering. Declares where the offering is relevant — for location-specific offerings such as job vacancies, in-store promotions, or local events. Platforms use this to target geographically appropriate audiences and to filter out offerings irrelevant to a user's location. Uses the same geographic structures as targeting_overlay in create_media_buy.

countries.description: Countries where this offering is relevant. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes (e.g., 'US', 'NL', 'DE').

metros.description: Metro areas where this offering is relevant. Each entry specifies the classification system and target values.

postal_areas.description: Postal areas where this offering is relevant. Each entry specifies the postal system and target values.

regions.description: Regions or states where this offering is relevant. ISO 3166-2 subdivision codes (e.g., 'NL-NH', 'US-CA').

keywords.description: Keywords for matching this offering to user intent. Hosts use these for retrieval/relevance scoring.

landing_url.description: Landing page URL for this offering. For catalog-driven creatives, this is the per-item click-through destination that platforms map to the ad's link-out URL. Every offering in a catalog should have a landing_url unless the format provides its own destination logic.

name.description: Human-readable offering name (e.g., 'Winter Sale', 'Free Trial', 'Enterprise Platform')

offering_id.description: Unique identifier for this offering. Used by hosts to reference specific offerings in si_get_offering calls.

tagline.description: Short promotional tagline for the offering

valid_from.description: When the offering becomes available. If not specified, offering is immediately available.

valid_to.description: When the offering expires. If not specified, offering has no expiration.

title: Offering
